content: I have a PR where one line is too long, and so dutifully github has told me this ~1600 times: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9923295560/job/27413283964?pr=14719
I assume this is the new linter infrastructure misfiring?

This is very likely a regression from #14676. I saw this issue during development of the linter change, found a bug in my code (after which this didn't occur any more) and assumed that this issue was also fixed.
I'll investigate asap (say, Monday). If this is too annoying, feel free to revert #14676 for now.
If you want to check: does reverting 6cb926522967c4b303aafa2b4cac2ec95695656c (the last functional change from #14676) fix this?
I checked: #14676 indeed caused this --- and it's a trivial one-line fix: #14724
Suggestions welcome if there are better tests that would have prevented this. :-)
Michael Rothgang has marked this topic as resolved.
